text: Rubens is a ghost town in Pocahontas County, in the U.S. state of Iowa. ==History== The post office in the community was variously called Powhattan, Powhatan, and Reubens before it closed in 1884. Rubens was named for Peter Paul Rubens, a Flemish painter. ==References== Category:Geography of Pocahontas County, Iowa Category:Ghost towns in Iowa
title: Rubens, Iowa
